p.s: In the following, Shylock is going to be characterised.
In doing so there will be a special attention to the use of the language and extra on the stylistic devices.
Shylock is the antagonist to this play.
He is the exact contrast to Antonio and Bassanio.
Shylock is very religious and proud to be a Jew.
Due to that he is very rich and common for lending money.
Lending money is a sin in the Christian philosophy and they hate the Jews for it.
It is forbidden to lend money for Christians, that is why Antonio goes to Shylock, in his last decision of fear, because he is going to be bankrupted more or less out of money.
In the past Antonio has mocked and manipulated Shylock, betrayed him for his money and joked around with him on Shylock's costs.
This is why Shylock hates him and wishes him just the worst (l. 21).
He enjoys to hear that Antonio is going to be bankrupt (l. 20).
It seems that Shylock is very cold-hearted and mean, but he actually tries to definddefend and save himself from all the pain and sabotages he had to take in.
Now he changed from a naivnaive personality into a clever, strategic thinking man who wants to protect himself.
Furthermore, the lines state that he really loves his daughter Jessica and would do everything to get her back (l. 19).
Would she were hearsed at my foot and the ducats in her coffin(ll. 6f).
He want her badly by his side to take care of her and know her well.
In addition to that he would spend all his money and jewels on her (ll. 4f).
Shylock even organized a friend who should look out for her (l. 1).
All of that stresses his good intentions and his loev for his daughter.
He is a caring, sensible and motivated person when it comes to his family.
Religion is very important to Shylock, he is a proud Jew and is strong-headed in what he does (ll. 14, 29).
In addition to that his actions and behaviour about finding his daughter show that he is strong-willing to get what he wants.
In line 3, A diamond gone is a similiesimile.
It stands for his daughter and how much she is worth for him.
His care is stresses through the anaphora before that.
The repetition of the word there (l. 3).
It underlines his pain of the loss.
The monologue from line 3 to 10, is filled with a lot of conditional sentences.
He uses a simple sentence structure with a lot of parallelism.
It underlines the satisfaction (l. 9) and his pain, because he is grieving and feels sorrow for loosinglosing Jessica (ll. 9f).
In addition to that, it gets obvious that his family takes a huge amount of love in his life.
Because the ring he gave to his wife, is very important to him.
I would not have given it for a wilderness of monkeys(l. 25).
The metaphor stresses the significance of the ring and his love for his dead wife.
He is a real family-lover and knows the worth of emotional things eventhougheven though they are materialistic.
He is on this level very down-to-earth.
On the other site, Shylock is very revengeful and loves to have the power I can make what merchandise I will (ll. 28f) to decide about the destiny of others.
He is gleeful (l. 22).
The same sentence structure and the parallelism stresses the fact Shylock is often repeating himself (ll. 5, 12, 16).
EverytimeEvery time when he does that he expresses his emotions and thoughts about something.
Sometimes he is worried, then happy, cheerful or feels malicious pleasure.
Shylock is very present and always knows how to behave.
This could be because of his long life his high age and his life experiences.
He also loves his family and gives great care to his beloved daughter.
There is a huge character development of Shylock's person.

He started to be very naivnaive, kind and unexperienced and throughout life he changed to be strategic, logical-thinking, cold, revengeful, power-hungry but also caring, loving and experienced how to handle with life situations.
